article.title: A note on species realizations and nondegeneracy of potentials

multiple_choice_question.text: According to Definition 2.11, what type of element is a potential P?
choices: An element of the cyclic part of Fs(M), denoted Fs(M)cyc.
An element of the tensor algebra Ts(M).
An element of the S-bimodule M.

multiple_choice_question.text: Theorem 3.5 states that under the condition of an uncountable underlying field F, Fs(M) admits what kind of potential?
What characteristic of the matrices defined by Equation 5.1 prevents them from being covered by the findings in [7], as stated in Proposition 5.1?
choices: The values of a and b are not restricted to being coprime.
They always admit a global unfolding.

multiple_choice_question.text: Lemma 4.5 focuses on a reduced potential P and two distinct integers k1 and k2 within the range [1, n]. What condition involving these elements leads to the conclusion that P is a non-degenerate potential in Fs(M)?
